database

Class DatabaseLinker

  • java.lang.Object
    • database.DatabaseLinker

  • public class DatabaseLinker
extends java.lang.Object
    The DatabaseLinker class is the main class in the model for interacting with the database for the applciation. It contains all the logic for connecting to the remote database, as well as all the queries for selecting and updating tables.
    Author:
    d_mit

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DatabaseLinker()
      The DatabaseLinker constructor immediately searches for the driver postgresql driver, inluded in the dependencies.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DatabaseLinker

        public DatabaseLinker()
        The DatabaseLinker constructor immediately searches for the driver postgresql driver, inluded in the dependencies.

    • Method Detail

      • writeUser

        public void writeUser(java.lang.String email,
                      java.lang.String pass)
        This method is called when the user first registers an account with the application.

        It stores the email address as a varchar(64) and encrpts the password with the bf hashing algorithm before storing it as a varchar(64) also.

        Parameters:
        email - validated email string
        pass - unencrypted string

      • writeTeamDetails

        public void writeTeamDetails(java.util.UUID team_id,
                             java.lang.String name,
                             double budget,
                             java.util.UUID captain_id)
        This method is the first of three methods that are called when the user has finished registering an account and has created a team with valid players and name.

        This method writes to a database table called team_details. It stores the main identifying and other miscellaneous information about a team.

        Parameters:
        team_id - the uuid of the team
        name - the name of the team
        budget - the remaining budget of the team after team creation
        captain_id - the randomly selected uuid of a player in the team

      • writeTeam

        public void writeTeam(java.util.UUID team_id,
                      java.util.UUID owner_id)
        This method is the second of three methods that are called when the user has finished registering an account and has created a team with valid players and name.

        The teams table the query stores the values to, is used to identify what team belongs to a particular user.

        Parameters:
        team_id - the uuid of the team
        owner_id - the uuid of the owner(user)

      • writeTeamMembership

        public void writeTeamMembership(java.util.UUID team_id,
                                java.util.UUID player_id,
                                int round,
                                int position)
        This is the last of three methods that are called when the user has finished registering an account and has created a team with valid players and name.

        The method writes a tuple for each of the 15 players in a team, after each round has finished. It helps to assert who was a member of a team during a particular round, and is used to develop a points history of a team.

        Parameters:
        team_id - the uuid of the team
        player_id - the uuid of the player
        round - an integer of the round, for indicating when the player was a part of that team
        position - an integer for indicating what position the player played in for a round

      • writeLeagueMembership

        public void writeLeagueMembership(java.util.UUID league_id,
                                  java.util.UUID team_id,
                                  int score)
        This method is called to register a team with a new league.

        The method is called immediately after a user registers a team, as every team msut be registered to the Public League. Each time a user new user registers, their score is set at 0.

        Parameters:
        league_id - is the uuid of the league being joined
        team_id - is the uuid of the team joining the league
        score - the score of the team in the league (initially 0)

      • writeFixture

        public void writeFixture(int fixture_id,
                         int round,
                         int home_club,
                         int away_club)
        This method is used to store all the previous fixtures that have already been played.

        This method is called at the beginning of the score building process. This ensures that the score building does not repeat the process for fixtures that have already been dealt with.

        Parameters:
        fixture_id - the integer id of the fixture (same as API)
        round - integer indicating when fixture took place
        home_club - integer id of the home club that played in the fixture (same as API)
        away_club - integer id of the away club that played in the fixture (same as API)

      • writeScore

        public void writeScore(int round,
                       java.util.UUID player_id,
                       int goals,
                       int assists,
                       int red_cards,
                       int yellow_cards,
                       int appearances,
                       int clean_sheets,
                       int concede_two,
                       int own_goals,
                       int fixture_id)
        This method is called when those scores need to be stored. Once a fixture has been stored in its respective database table, all of the match data associated with that fixture is compiled and turned a score card for each individual player that participated in that fixture.

        The method is called as part of the score building process.

        Parameters:
        round - integer indicating what round the fixture took place
        player_id - the uuid of the player who's score card it is
        goals - integer indicating the number of goals the player scored
        assists - integer indicating the number of assists the player had
        red_cards - integer indicating the number of red cards the player had
        yellow_cards - integer indicating the number of yellow cards the player had
        appearances - integer indicating if the player appeared on the pitch, '1' if they played on the pitch, '0' if they stayed on the bench
        clean_sheets - integer indicating the number of clean sheets the player had (only relevant to goalkeeper, defender and midfielders)
        concede_two - integer indicating if the team had conceded more than two goals (only relevant to goalkeepers, defenders and midfielders)
        own_goals - integer indicating the number of own goals the player had
        fixture_id - integer id indicating what fixture the score was for

      • writePlayerPoints

        public void writePlayerPoints(java.util.UUID player_id,
                              int round,
                              int score)
        This method stores the calculated total points from the score card and stores it in a separate table.

        The method is called as part of the score builidng process.

        Parameters:
        player_id - the uuid of the player
        round - an integer indicating the round the points were for
        score - an integer of the total points that round

      • writeTeamPoints

        public void writeTeamPoints(java.util.UUID team_id,
                            int round,
                            int score)
        This mehtod stores the weekly score of the team in the database.

        It is called from a seperate method in the main model that deals with compling the teams scores. This score would be an accumulation of the 11 players who were fielded during a round.

        Parameters:
        team_id - uuid of the team
        round - integer indicating the round
        score - integer indicating the total points

      • authenticateUser

        public java.lang.String authenticateUser(java.lang.String email,
                                         java.lang.String pass)
        This authentication method will check if a user exists on the database when logging in, before allowing them to access the whole application.

        If the user is not registed, then a null id is returned and the user is denied access. If they are registed on the databse, then the assoaicted user id is returned and used to select and display data relevant to the user logging in.

        Parameters:
        email - the email string entered by the user
        pass - the password entered by the user
        Returns:
        the uuid of the user

      • doesUserExist

        public java.lang.String doesUserExist(java.lang.String email)
        This method checks to see if a user exists on the database during user registration.

        It is different from the authentication method used during login, because it only searches for the users email address. This method is used to avoid users registering the same email address twice and creating duplicate entries. It returns the id of the user or null if not found.

        Parameters:
        email - the email adrress String of the user
        Returns:
        the user's uuid

      • doesTeamExist

        public java.util.UUID doesTeamExist(java.lang.String email)
        Used to indicate wether a user has completed the team creation process and is called after a user has been authenticated for login.

        This method was introduced for the situations where a user may be interupted when making their account and team. It allows the user to create their team separately from their account and reduces any errors related to empty teams.

        Parameters:
        email - the email address of the user
        Returns:
        the uuid of the user's registered team

      • doesTeamExist

        public boolean doesTeamExist(java.util.UUID team_id,
                             int round)
        This method is used when builidng the points history of a team.

        It is called to check when a team was registered on the database. A user may register a team at any point in the season so it was important to check through each of the rounds, and determine at what point the team was made to display the correct information.

        Parameters:
        team_id - the uuid of the team
        round - the integer of the round that the team is being checked to have existed in
        Returns:
        a boolean indicating if the team was present in a particular round

      • doesFixtureExist

        public boolean doesFixtureExist(int fixture_id)
        Used in the score builidng process to ensure that the same fixture is not being recorded more than once.

        It is called as a conditional check, directly before the fixture is wrote to the database.

        Parameters:
        fixture_id - the uuid of the fixture
        Returns:
        a boolean indicating if the fixture is present in the database or not

      • doesScoreExist

        public boolean doesScoreExist(int fixture_id)
        Used in the score builidng process to ensure that the same score is not being recorded more than once.
        Parameters:
        fixture_id - the uuid of the fixture
        Returns:
        a boolean indicating if the score is present in the database or not

      • doesPlayerPointsExist

        public boolean doesPlayerPointsExist(java.util.UUID player_id,
                                     int round)
        Used in the score builidng process to ensure that the same player weekly points score is not being recorded more than once.
        Parameters:
        player_id - uuid of the player
        round - integer indicating the round of the score
        Returns:
        a boolean indicating if the player points is present in the database or not during that round

      • doesTeamPointsExist

        public boolean doesTeamPointsExist(java.util.UUID team_id,
                                   int round)
        Used in the score builidng process to ensure that the same team weekly points score is not being recorded more than once.
        Parameters:
        team_id - uuid of the team
        round - integer indicating the round of the score
        Returns:
        a boolean indicating if the team points is present in the database or not during that round

      • doesTeamMembershipExist

        public boolean doesTeamMembershipExist(java.util.UUID team_id,
                                       java.util.UUID player_id,
                                       int round)
        Used in the score builidng process to ensure that the same team membership is not being recorded more than once.
        Parameters:
        team_id - the uuid of the team
        player_id - the uuid of the player
        round - an integer indicating the round in which the player was a part of that team
        Returns:
        a boolean indicating if the team membership is present in the database or not during that round

      • isTransferOn

        public boolean isTransferOn(java.util.UUID team_id)
        This method is called when a user tries to access the transfer page of the interface.

        It checks the boolean transfer attribute of team details for a particular user. This is handled by the database because individual users can choose to spend their transfer credit for their team at any point before a round begins.

        Parameters:
        team_id - the uuid of the team
        Returns:
        a boolean indicating if the team is allowed to make a transfer or not

      • loadUsers

        public java.util.ArrayList<User> loadUsers()
        This is an initialisation method that is called when the application first starts.

        It selects and loads all of the users recorded on the database and stores them in an arraylist that is then used by the main model.

        Returns:
        an arraylist of all the users regisered on the database

      • loadLeagues

        public java.util.ArrayList<League> loadLeagues()
        This is an initialisation method that is called when the application first starts.

        It selects and loads all of the public and private leagues recorded on the database and stores them in an arraylist that is then used by the main model.

        As private leagues were not fully implmented in the final version, this method was unused but left in for future work.

        Returns:
        an arraylist of all the leagues created and regisered on the database

      • loadMembers

        public java.util.HashMap<java.util.UUID,java.lang.Integer> loadMembers(java.util.UUID league_id)
        This method is called as part of the initialsiation. It is called by the loadLeagues() method which loads each of participating memebers into the League objects.

        It builds a HashMap of all the participating users and their current scores in that league.

        As private leagues were not fully implmented in the final version, this method was unused but left in for future work.

        Parameters:
        league_id -
        Returns:

      • loadPlayers

        public java.util.ArrayList<Player> loadPlayers()
        This is an initialisation method that is called when the application first starts.

        It selects and loads all of the players recorded on the database and stores them in an arraylist that is used by the databaselinker class, the arraylist is also returned for use in the main model.

        Returns:
        an arraylist of all the players stored in the database

      • loadClubs

        public java.util.ArrayList<Club> loadClubs()
        This is an initialisation method that is called when the application first starts.

        It selects and loads all of the clubs recorded on the database and stores them in an arraylist that is then used by the main model.

        Returns:
        an arraylist of all the clubs stored in the database

      • loadTeam

        public Team loadTeam(java.util.UUID user_id,
                     int round)
        This method is the first of three methods that are called by the model to return all infomration about a team. It is called when the user logs in and when writing team scores.

        This method simply searches the teams table for a user's team's team_id before using that id to make another call to other database methods that return further data. It creates an empty team object and passes it to the loadTeamDetails() method.

        Parameters:
        user_id - the uuid of the user
        round - an integer of the previous round in which the team was last stored
        Returns:
        a Team object

      • loadTeamDetails

        public Team loadTeamDetails(java.util.UUID team_id,
                            Team team,
                            int round)
        This is the second method called when returning team information.

        This method helps to collect the other identifying information such as the name, remaining budget, captain's id and trasfer boolean, it uses the team_id from loadTeam() to search the team_details table.

        Parameters:
        team_id - uuid of the team
        team - the newly instantiated team object passed from loadTeam()
        round - an integer of the previous round in which the team was last stored
        Returns:
        a Team object

      • loadSquad

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,Player> loadSquad(java.util.UUID team_id,
                                                             int round)
        This is the last of three methods called when returning team information.

        It searches through the team membership table using the team_id and the latest round integer to build an hashmap of the most up to date squad for a team, with each of their associated positions.

        Parameters:
        team_id - the uuid of the team
        round - an integer of the previous round in which the team was last stored
        Returns:
        a HashMap with 15 players and their associated positions in the team at that round

      • getPlayerScoreIn

        public int getPlayerScoreIn(java.util.UUID player_id,
                            int round)
        This method is used to help build the points history. It is called to return the score a player attained during a particular week.
        Parameters:
        player_id - the uuid of the player
        round - an integer indicating from what round the score should be returned for
        Returns:
        the total score of the player from a particular round

      • calculateTeamScore

        public int calculateTeamScore(java.util.UUID team_id,
                              int round)
        This method is also called as part of the team score building process in the model after the schedule update.

        The method compilies all of the individual player scores in the player_weekly_scores table and calculates a total.

        Parameters:
        team_id - the uuid of the team
        round - the round integer the score is being calucalted for
        Returns:
        the total weekly score integer for the team that round

      • getPreviousLeagueScores

        public java.util.HashMap<java.util.UUID,java.lang.Integer> getPreviousLeagueScores(java.util.UUID team_id)
        This method is called as part of the team score builidng. It is used to fetch the previously recorded league score so it can be appended with the latest team score.

        A user could join a league at any time and have different scores for each one.

        Parameters:
        team_id - the uuid of the team
        Returns:
        a HashMap of the previously recorded scores for a team participating in different leagues

      • getRankInLeague

        public int getRankInLeague(java.util.UUID league_id,
                           java.util.UUID team_id)
        This method returns the postion of a team in a particular league.

        This information is displayed on the HomeScreen

        Parameters:
        league_id - the uuid of the league
        team_id - the uuid of the team
        Returns:
        the ranked position of a team in a league table

      • getPublicRankings

        public java.util.ArrayList<Ranking> getPublicRankings()
        This method is used for returning the the full ranked leaderboard of the Global public league.

        It is used to display the full leaderboard implemented into the LeagueScreeen.

        Returns:
        an arraylist of all all the rankings for the players in the public league.

      • getGlobalAverage

        public int getGlobalAverage()
        This method is used for calculating and displaying the average score of all the teams in the Global public league.

        This infomartion is dispalyed on the HomeScreen.

        Returns:
        integer of average score in public league

      • getGlobalMax

        public int getGlobalMax()
        This method is used for calculating and displaying the highest score of all the teams in the Global public league.

        This infomartion is dispalyed on the HomeScreen.

        Returns:
        integer of highest score in public league

      • getTeamTotal

        public int getTeamTotal(java.util.UUID team_id)
        This method returns the all time total score for a particular team.

        It is called when the user logs in, and is displayed on the HomeScreen.

        Parameters:
        team_id - uuid of the team
        Returns:
        integer of total score in public league for a particular team

      • updateTeamMembership

        public void updateTeamMembership(java.util.UUID team_id,
                                 java.util.UUID player_id,
                                 int round,
                                 int position)
        This method is called when a user decides to update their team by making a transfer from the TransferScreen. The user selects a player to swap out and another to swap in. Since this happens between rounds, an update must be made to the table using the current round integer.
        Parameters:
        team_id - uuid of the team
        player_id - uuid of the player being transfered in
        round - the integer of the current round
        position - the position integer of the player being swapped out

      • updateTeamPositions

        public void updateTeamPositions(java.util.UUID team_id,
                                java.util.UUID player_id,
                                int round,
                                int position)
        This method is called when a user decides they want to manage their team of existing players. No new players are introduced into the team but instead the positions are changed around as substitions are made.
        Parameters:
        team_id - uuid of the team being managed
        player_id - uuid of the players being substituted
        round - the integer of the current round
        position - the position integer of the player being substituted

      • updateTeamDetails

        public void updateTeamDetails(java.util.UUID team_id,
                              double transferBudget,
                              java.util.UUID captain_id)
        This method is called when a user decided to either make a transfer or manage their team.

        It is used in the manage screen to store any changes made to the selected captain and in the transfer screen to update any changes to the transfer budget from new players brought in.

        Parameters:
        team_id - the uuid of the team
        transferBudget - the remaining transfer budget of the team
        captain_id - the uuid of the teams captain

      • updateLeagueScore

        public void updateLeagueScore(java.util.UUID league_id,
                              java.util.UUID team_id,
                              int score)
        This method is called in the team score building process, after the team scores for the current round have been comiled, and the previous league score has been fetched. The model calucaltes a new score and then calls this method to update.
        Parameters:
        league_id - the uuid of the league
        team_id - the uuid of the team
        score - the newly calculated score for a team in a league

      • setTransfer

        public void setTransfer(java.util.UUID team_id,
                        boolean transfer)
        This method is called when a user has finished making a transfer. As each team is only allowed to make one transfer between rounds, the transfer boolean is set to false so no more transfers can be made till the next round commences.
        Parameters:
        team_id - the uuid of the team
        transfer - a boolean for permitting transfer activity

      • setTransferAll

        public void setTransferAll(boolean transfer)
        This method is called by the scheduleBlock and scheduleUpdate methods in the model when a round of fixtures has started or finished, respectively.

        Depending on wether the round has started or finished, the transfer boolean for all teams in the database is set to false to deny transfer activity, or to true to enable it.

        Parameters:
        transfer - a boolean for permitting or deny transfer activity
